text.p:
It was proposed lately that spontaneous emission rate for THz photons can be additionally increased by bosonic
stimulation when the radiative transition occurs into a condensed state [1], for example, a transition between upper
and lower polariton branches in semiconductor microcavity.

In the current work we use Lindblad master equation approach [2] to describe time evolution of the system of cavity
polaritons in the regime of polariton lasing of THz emittion accounting for quantum nature of terahertz-to-polariton
coupling and demonstrate that quantum microcavities reveal rich variety of nonlinear phenomena, including bistability
and THz switching [3].
It is well known that strong polariton-polariton interactions in microcavities make it possible to observe the pronounced
nonlinear effects even for relatively weak intensities of pump (orders of magnitude smaller then in other optical
nonlinear systems). In this work we describe the formalism accounting for the following physical processes: coherent
polariton-THz photon interaction, polariton-polariton scattering leading to the blueshift of the polariton modes and
coupling of the polaritons with acoustic phonons (represented as a reservoir).

The main results are presented on Fig. 1-2. On Fig. 1 the threshold characteristics is presented for different temperatures
where our approach predicts bistable behaviour with hysteresis. Also we worked-out a logical devise with switching
of signal by means of short THz impulse at t = t 0 (see Fig. 2): if the background pump corresponds to the bistability
region the signal can be switched from "0" to "1".
